title: Grammys Performers List 2017: Lady Gaga, John Legend & More
text:
share 
The 2017 Grammys on Sunday will feature performances from the biggest names in music. Find out all of the performers below! 
The first round of music acts for the 59th annual Grammy Awards was announced by the Recording Academy in January. It was revealed John Legend, Keith Urban, Metallica, and Carrie Underwood had all signed up to take the stage at the Staples Center. Weeks later, it was confirmed Legend would lead the In Memoriam with Cynthia Erivo, Metallica would collaborate with Lady Gaga, and Urban and Underwood would duet together. Subsequent announcements confirmed Adele, Bruno Mars, Chance The Rapper, Alicia Keys and Maren Morris all planned to perform, too. In addition to those artists, Demi Lovato and Tori Kelly will join Little Big Town and Andra Day for a tribute to the Bee Gees. Daft Punk and The Weeknd are teaming up, as are William Bell and Gary Clark Jr. A Tribute Called Quest will also partner with Anderson Paak. Meanwhile, Kelsea Ballerini, Lukas Graham, Sturgill Simpson and Katy Perry will all get time in the music spotlight, too. 
But those are only the announced performers. Though not officially confirmed, Beyonce, who is this year’s leading nominee with nine nominations, is widely expected to perform, too, despite being several months pregnant. And the Recording Academy has also promised tributes to two late greats, Prince and George Michael, but hasn’t revealed any of specific artists who will be taking part. 
Whatever goes down, Gossip Cop will be highlighting the biggest and best performances. Stay tuned for our Grammy coverage on Sunday night!
